channel.title: Coyote REP Theatre Company
channel.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Sound Play Series
channel.itunes:summary: Coyote REP is a New York based Theater Company that provides a podcast of original Sound Plays. Coyote REP is an artistic home dedicated to balancing process and production. We are committed to developing, producing and inspiring original plays that challenge, surprise and arouse through innovative means: Recorded sound plays, an Electronic documentary and Productions for the stage.

item.title: girl by Megan Mostyn-Brown
item.description: Sex, drugs, self-abuse and best friends... nobody says being a girl was easy. Directed by Josh Hecht, Sound Design by Mitchell Greenhill, Engineered by Allistar Peters. Featuring: Susan Hunt, Florencia Lozano, Rachel Mewbron, Thom Rivera, and Maggie Siff.
item.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
item.itunes:subtitle: Sex, drugs, self-abuse and best friends... nobody says being a girl was easy.
item.itunes:summary: Sex, drugs, self-abuse and best friends... nobody says being a girl was easy. Directed by Josh Hecht, Sound Design by Mitchell Greenhill, Engineered by Allistar Peters. Featuring: Susan Hunt, Florencia Lozano, Rachel Mewbron, Thom Rivera, and Maggie Siff.
item.itunes:keywords: Coyote REP, Sound Plays, theater, girl, Megan Mostyn-Brown

item.title: Patriot Act (An Occurrence at Yankee Stadium) by Robert Emmet Lunney
item.description: Kevin Coogan's life flashes before his eyes when he fall from the upper deck of Yankee Stadium into a top secret world of intrigue and National Security. Directed by Richard Romagnoli. Featuring Donnetta Lavinia Grays, Glenn Kalison, Keith Randolph Smith, Jonathan Walker, George Preston and Brad Cresswell. Sound Design and Original Music Composition by Mitch Greenhill. Sound engineering by Allistar Peters. Recorded at WNYC studios in New York.
item.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
item.itunes:subtitle: Kevin Coogan's life flashes before his eyes when he fall from the upper deck of Yankee Stadium into a top secret world of intrigue and National Security.
item.itunes:summary: Kevin Coogan's life flashes before his eyes when he fall from the upper deck of Yankee Stadium into a top secret world of intrigue and National Security. item.itunes:keywords: Coyote REP, Patriot Act, Yankee Stadium, Sound Plays, Robert Emmet Lunney

item.title: The Boy at the Window by Douglas Braverman
item.description: Once you leave Neverland, you have to grow up. Directed by Olivia Mora and Teresa Pond, Sound Design by Joshua Hilson, Engineered by Damon Whittemore. Featuring: Brandon Collinsworth, Jake Dogias, Steve Hauck, Glenn Kalison, Emily Rogge, Rebecca Tourino. Recorded at WNYC studios in New York.
item.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
item.itunes:subtitle: Once you leave Neverland, you have to grow up.
item.itunes:summary: Once you leave Neverland, you have to grow up. Directed by Olivia Mora and Teresa Pond, Sound Design by Joshua Hilson, Engineered by Damon Whittemore. Featuring: Brandon Collinsworth, Jake Dogias, Steve Hauck, Glenn Kalison, Emily Rogge, Rebecca Tourino. Recorded at WNYC studios in New York.
item.itunes:keywords: Coyote REP, The Boy at the Window, Sound Plays, Douglas Braverman, Neverland, Peter Pan

item.title: Coyote Rising by Tira Palmquist
item.description: Sometimes the past won't let you go. It's Thanksgiving weekend on a deserted stretch of Iowa highway. Brothers Peter and Jason Solomon hit a coyote and crash into a ditch. Forced to intrude on the nearest family, the weekend takes a strange turn as old mistakes, present loss and new love turn brother against brother, sister against sister, and an old friend into an enemy. As the bonds of family are strained and the struggle for survival ensues, each must face the decision of remaining with the pack or striking out on his own. Directed by Jeanne LaSala. Sound Design by Mitch Greenhil. Original Music by Lauren Echo from her CD Still. Engineered by Damon Whittemore. Featuring: Carrie Baker, Maria Cellario , Michelle Cowin, Dudley Knight, Richard Padro, Thom Rivera and Heidi Tokheim. Recorded at WNYC studios in New York.
item.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes the past won't let you go.
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes the past won't let you go. It's Thanksgiving weekend on a deserted stretch of Iowa highway. Brothers Peter and Jason Solomon hit a coyote and crash into a ditch. Forced to intrude on the nearest family, the weekend takes a strange turn as old mistakes, present loss and new love turn brother against brother, sister against sister, and an old friend into an enemy. As the bonds of family are strained and the struggle for survival ensues, each must face the decision of remaining with the pack or striking out on his own. Directed by Jeanne LaSala. Sound Design by Mitch Greenhil. Original Music by Lauren Echo from her CD Still. Engineered by Damon Whittemore. Featuring: Carrie Baker, Maria Cellario , Michelle Cowin, Dudley Knight, Richard Padro, Thom Rivera and Heidi Tokheim. Recorded at WNYC studios in New York.
item.itunes:keywords: Coyote REP, Coyote Rising, Sound Plays, Tira Palmquist, Thanksgiving

item.title: Deception, Episode 1 - by Jeremy Dobrish
item.description: What if everything you ever told everyone was a lie? Episode 1 of Coyote REP's thrilling sound play series directed by Glenn Kalison with Sound Design and Music Composition by Mitch Greenhill.
item.itunes:author: Coyote REP Theatre Company
item.itunes:subtitle: What if everything you ever told everyone was a lie?
